short_description: This function is used to perform a comparison between 2 time series.
long_description: This function is used to perform a Fast Dynamic Time Warping time series analysis.

input_tables.name: inputTable
input_tables.rDescription: the table contains the time series information
input_tables.description: the table contains the time series information

input_tables.name: templateTable
input_tables.rDescription: the table contains the template information
input_tables.description: the table contains the template information

input_tables.name: mappingTable
input_tables.rDescription: the table contains the mapping between the rows in the inputTable and the rows in the templateTable
input_tables.description: the table contains the mapping between the rows in the inputTable and the rows in the templateTable

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the data columns that contain the values and timestamps of the time series. Note that the input.columns argument has the alternate name input.columns. Note: If these columns contain NaN or infinity values, then use a WHERE clause to remove them.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input_table columns that contain the values and timestamps of the time series. Note that the InputColumns argument has the alternate name Input_Table_Value_Column_Names. Note: If these columns contain NaN or infinity values, then use a WHERE clause to remove them.

argument_clauses.name: TemplateColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the template_table columns that contain the values and timestamps of the time series. Note that the template.columns argument has the alternate name template.columns. Note: If these columns contain NaN or infinity values, then use a WHERE clause to remove them.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the template_table columns that contain the values and timestamps of the time series. Note that the TemplateColumns argument has the alternate name Template_Table_Value_Column_Names. Note: If these columns contain NaN or infinity values, then use a WHERE clause to remove them.

argument_clauses.name: TimeseriesId
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns by which the input_table is partitioned. These columns comprise the unique ID for a time series in input_table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns by which the input_table is partitioned. These columns comprise the unique ID for a time series in input_table.

argument_clauses.name: TemplateId
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns by which the template_table is ordered. These columns comprise the unique ID for a time series in template_table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns by which the template_table is ordered. These columns comprise the unique ID for a time series in template_table.

argument_clauses.name: Radius
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the integer value that determines the projected warp path from a previous resolution. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the integer value that determines the projected warp path from a previous resolution. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: DistMethod
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the metric for computing the warping distance. The supported values of distance_metric, which are case-sensitive, are: 'EuclideanDistance' (default),'ManhattanDistance', 'BinaryDistance'.contract Note that the DistMethod argument has the alternate name Metric.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the metric for computing the warping distance. The supported values of distance_metric, which are case-sensitive, are: 'EuclideanDistance' (default),'ManhattanDistance', 'BinaryDistance'.contract Note that the DistMethod argument has the alternate name Metric.

argument_clauses.name: WarpPath
argument_clauses.rDescription: Determines whether to output the warping path. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Determines whether to output the warping path. The default value is 'false'.
